decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy with counterspells, discard spells, and removal while generating value through card advantage and powerful creatures. The deck aims to out-grind opponent and establish a strong board presence with efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Stoneforge Mystic. The presence of versatile cards like Deathrite Shaman and Liliana allows the deck to adapt to different situations and maintain its control over the game. The mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility, allowing the deck to handle a wide range of threats.

The deck focuses on using Cloudpost lands to generate a large amount of mana quickly, allowing the player to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures ahead of schedule. This strategy is supported by cards like Grim Monolith, Thran Dynamo, and Ancient Tomb. The deck also includes controlling elements like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with giant Eldrazi threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, while using cards like Thought-Knot Seer to disrupt the opponent's hand.

The deck is focused on quickly deploying aggressive Merfolk creatures using Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls to enable them to avoid countermagic. Chalice of the Void is used to disrupt opponents' spells, while Force of Will provides additional protection. The inclusion of True-Name Nemesis makes it difficult for opponents to remove key creatures, while Lords of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident boost all Merfolk on the board. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence early on and overwhelm opponents with its creature synergy.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures by utilizing mana acceleration from lands like Eldrazi Temple and Ancient Tomb. The deck also disrupts opponents with Chalice of the Void and removal spells like Dismember. The creatures in this deck, such as Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher, put pressure on opponents and can quickly close out games. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, large threats and disrupt their game plan with disruptive spells in order to secure a swift victory.

The main concept of this deck is to gain control of the game through a combination of powerful creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Deathrite Shaman, Leovold, Emissary of Trest, and Baleful Strix, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Kolaghan's Command, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing its own board presence. Additionally, the deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana, the Last Hope to further control the game. The deck's mana base allows for flexibility in casting its spells efficiently.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources by utilizing land destruction with cards like Wasteland and Punishing Fire. The main combo of Life from the Loam and Knight of the Reliquary allows for consistent land recursion and mana ramp, while cards like Liliana of the Veil and Abrupt Decay provide additional removal and disruption. The deck also incorporates powerful utility lands like Karakas and Maze of Ith to protect key creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outgrind the opponent through efficient resource management and versatile threats.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It uses cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Spirit of the Labyrinth to slow down the opponent's spells, while utilizing Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play. By utilizing powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice, the deck aims to close out games quickly. The deck also includes disruptive lands like Wasteland and Rishadan Port to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Overall, the deck seeks to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of disruption and aggression.

This deck focuses on combining aggressive creature threats with disruption and removal spells to control the pace of the game and overwhelm the opponent. By using efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Deathrite Shaman alongside powerful spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure. The inclusion of versatile cards like Punishing Fire and Kolaghan's Command allows the deck to adapt to various matchups and situations. Liliana, the Last Hope and Liliana of the Veil provide additional disruption and removal options to further control the game.

The deck focuses on assembling the Aluren combo to generate card advantage and disrupt opponent's game plan. It utilizes efficient creatures like Baleful Strix, Recruiter of the Guard, and Veteran Explorer to control the board and find key pieces. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy to interact with the opponent's strategy. The key concept revolves around using Aluren to continuously cast creatures for free, overwhelm the opponent, and gain incremental advantage to eventually win the game.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on quickly playing powerful Eldrazi creatures by utilizing mana acceleration from lands like Eldrazi Temple and Ancient Tomb. It also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer to control the opponent's resources and hand. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggressive threats like Reality Smasher and disruptive creatures like Eldrazi Displacer, while also utilizing equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Light and Shadow to gain an advantage in combat.

The key strategy of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with a combination of counter spells, hand disruption, and removal, while generating card advantage and pressure with Young Pyromancer and Gurmag Angler. The deck focuses on controlling the board and tempo of the game, using cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's plays while setting up its own win condition. By efficiently managing resources and leveraging its versatile spell suite, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver its opponent to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through counterspells and removal while utilizing powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte, Sword of Fire and Ice, and Batterskull to gain advantage in combat. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Spell Snare, Swords to Plowshares, and Force of Will, while also having access to card draw and selection through Brainstorm and Ponder. Additionally, creatures like Snapcaster Mage, Stoneforge Mystic, and Vendilion Clique provide additional versatility and threats to the opponent.

The main objective of this deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent by efficiently deploying threats like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Knight of the Reliquary. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Wasteland and Thalia, while also gaining advantage through cards like Sylvan Library and Umezawa's Jitte. By utilizing a combination of aggressive creatures, disruption spells, and powerful equipment, this deck aims to control the pace of the game and secure victories through a proactive game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Chancellor of the Annex, then using spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back onto the battlefield, bypassing their mana costs. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Unmask and Thoughtseize to hinder the opponent's strategy, as well as Cabal Therapy to further manipulate their hand. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces and cheat out a massive threat to overwhelm the opponent before they can react.

The deck focuses on using disruptive spells and creatures to control the game while leveraging the powerful equipment provided by Stoneforge Mystic. By combining hand disruption like Cabal Therapy with efficient removal like Swords to Plowshares, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game until it can establish a dominant board presence with cards like Monastery Mentor and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck also utilizes Gitaxian Probe to gain information on the opponent's hand and maximize the effectiveness of its disruption spells.

This UWx Control Legacy deck aims to control the game through disruptive spells like Counterspell, Force of Will, and Swords to Plowshares, while also utilizing card advantage from Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage. The deck focuses on manipulating the top of the deck with cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Predict to set up efficient plays, while using Counterbalance to disrupt opponents' spells. The win condition is either through incremental advantage gained over time or by resolving powerful threats like Entreat the Angels. The mana base is well-balanced to support the deck's color requirements.
